meanings.definition: Remove fragments from (a computer file) in order to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent1: I defragmented my computer to make it faster.
meanings.sent2: She defragmented the hard drive to improve its performance.
meanings.sent3: After I defragmented my files, my computer felt like it had a good spring cleaning.
meanings.sent4: The technician defragmented the system, smoothing out its operations like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: With a few clicks, I defragmented the files, making them neat and tidy.

meanings.definition: Make (something) more organized or efficient by removing or reorganizing unnecessary elements.
meanings.sent1: He defragmented the cluttered desk to create more space.
meanings.sent2: The company defragmented its processes to streamline operations.
meanings.sent3: I defragmented my closet by donating clothes I never wear.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt defragmented after organizing her thoughts like a well-structured essay.
meanings.sent5: The team defragmented the project plan, making it clear and easy to follow.
